content.full_text:
George W. Rives to Abraham Lincoln, March 18491 I take pleasure in introducing to you Mr.H. W. MartinEsqr[Esquire] ofEdgarHe is a Gentleman of high standing in myCounty– and desires to form some acquaintancies during his stay in thecityconnected with some business he is attending to. I hope you can give him some assistance
               with regard to his Visit toWashington City2
paragraphs: George W. Rives to Abraham Lincoln, March 18491

I take pleasure in introducing to you Mr.H. W. MartinEsqr[Esquire] ofEdgarHe is a Gentleman of high standing in myCounty– and desires to form some acquaintancies during his stay in thecityconnected with some business he is attending to. I hope you can give him some assistance
               with regard to his Visit toWashington City2

footnotes.text: 1George W. Rives wrote and signed this letter.
2The exact nature of Henry W. Martin’s business in Washington, DC has not been determined.
